{"step_by_step_thinking": "Captopril is an ACE inhibitor and triamterene is a potassium-sparing diuretic. Both of these medications can cause hyperkalemia, which is an elevated level of potassium in the blood. Hypernatremia is an elevated level of sodium in the blood, which is not a common side effect of either of these medications. Thrombocytopenia is a low platelet count, and anemia is a low red blood cell count, neither of which are common side effects of these medications.", "answer_choice": "A. Hyperkalemia"}
